html: President Charles W. Penrose applied these verses to the Latter-day Saints living in seclusion in the mountains of Zion (see CR, Oct. 1918, pp. 17-18). Joseph Smith used this passage to show that Judah would obtain deliverance at Jerusalem (see TPJS, p. 17). The context shows that the verses refer to the time when Judah will be secluded in Jerusalem and the arm of the Lord will fall upon the nations, as foretold by the Savior and repeated to the Prophet Joseph Smith (see D&C 45:16, 43-47).
